dateline.date: written 9 June, but misdated 10 June.| Thursday Tenth June 1853

body.p: I have been ill for a week,On CD's debilitating illness see To Lady Eastlake, 11 June 1853, in Pilgrim Letters 7, p. 95. and am left a little pulled down. So I purpose coming to your excellent care, tomorrow (Friday)10 June 1853. and staying until Sunday,12 June 1853, when CD and his family travelled to Boulogne. when, if it be fine weather I purpose crossingCD remarks, in a letter to W.H. Wills on 13 June, that he enjoyed "a delightful passage" to Boulogne (Pilgrim Letters 7, p. 98). to Boulogne for the summer.

p.hi: He asks for a quiet and cheerful room for himself and his family.
